title: Deuteronomy Chapter 18 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Deuteronomy chapter 18 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Deuteronomy Chapter 18 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Deuteronomy Chapter 18.

questions.question: According to Deuteronomy 18:1, which tribe shall have no part nor inheritance with Israel?
questions.correctAnswer: The Levites
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 18:1 states that the priests the Levites, and all the tribe of Levi, shall have no part nor inheritance with Israel.

questions.question: What is the inheritance of the Levites, according to Deuteronomy 18:2?
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD is their inheritance
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 18:2 explains that the LORD is their inheritance as He has said unto them.

questions.question: From what must the priests receive the shoulder, cheeks, and maw, according to Deuteronomy 18:3?
options: From those who offer a sacrifice
questions.correctAnswer: From those who offer a sacrifice
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 18:3 states that the priests shall receive these parts from people who offer sacrifices.

questions.question: What firstfruits must be given to the Levites as stated in Deuteronomy 18:4?
questions.correctAnswer: Corn, wine, oil, and fleece
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 18:4 instructs giving the firstfruits of corn, wine, oil, and the first of the fleece of sheep to the Levites.

questions.question: Why has the LORD chosen the Levites, according to Deuteronomy 18:5?
options: To minister in His name forever
questions.correctAnswer: To minister in His name forever
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 18:5 says God chose the Levites to minister in His name, him and his sons forever.

questions.question: According to Deuteronomy 18:9, what must the Israelites not learn to do in the land God gives them?
options: Do after the abominations of those nations
questions.correctAnswer: Do after the abominations of those nations
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 18:9 instructs not to learn to do the abominations of the nations in the land given by God.

questions.question: Which of these practices is forbidden in Deuteronomy 18:10?
questions.correctAnswer: Divination
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 18:10 forbids divination among other abominable practices.

questions.question: According to Deuteronomy 18:12, what is the LORD's attitude toward those who practice witchcraft and related abominations?
options: They are an abomination to the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: They are an abomination to the LORD
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 18:12 states that those who practice such things are an abomination to the LORD and He drives them out.

questions.question: What does Deuteronomy 18:13 command the Israelites to be with the LORD their God?
questions.correctAnswer: Perfect
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 18:13 commands the Israelites to be perfect with the LORD their God.

questions.question: In Deuteronomy 18:15, what does the LORD say He will raise up for Israel?
questions.correctAnswer: A prophet like unto Moses
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 18:15 states the LORD will raise up a prophet like Moses from among the brethren.

questions.question: True or False: Deuteronomy 18:20 says a prophet who speaks in the name of other gods shall live.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 18:20 clearly states that such a prophet shall die.

questions.question: True or False: According to Deuteronomy 18:22, a prophet whose predictions do not come to pass is not from the LORD.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 18:22 says if the prophet's words do not come to pass, the LORD did not speak them.

questions.question: True or False: Deuteronomy 18:14 states that Israel shall follow the practices of the nations they will possess.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 18:14 states the LORD has not suffered Israel to follow such practices.

questions.question: Fill in the blank from Deuteronomy 18:19: 'And it shall come to pass, that whosoever will not hearken unto my words which he shall speak in my name, I will ______ it of him.'
questions.correctAnswer: require
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 18:19 says the LORD will require it of anyone who does not hearken to the prophet's words.

questions.question: According to Deuteronomy 18:6, what must a Levite do if he comes from any of the gates of Israel with all his desire?
options: Come to the place the LORD shall choose
questions.correctAnswer: Come to the place the LORD shall choose
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 18:6 states a Levite must come to the place the LORD chooses with all his desire.

medium.title: Deuteronomy Chapter 18 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Deuteronomy Chapter 18 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does Deuteronomy 18 teach about trusting God in provision for spiritual leaders?
options: They shall eat the offerings of the LORD made by fire
They must earn their own inheritance from the land
They should rely on their own work for sustenance
They are not entitled to any share from the people
questions.correctAnswer: They shall eat the offerings of the LORD made by fire
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 18:1-2 explains that the Levites have no inheritance among Israel because the LORD is their inheritance, and they eat the offerings made by fire. This teaches reliance on God's provision rather than personal possessions.

questions.question: According to Deuteronomy 18, what should be given to the priests as their due from sacrifices?
options: The shoulder, the two cheeks, and the maw
questions.correctAnswer: The shoulder, the two cheeks, and the maw
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 18:3 specifies that the priests shall receive the shoulder, the two cheeks, and the maw from sacrifices, emphasizing God's provision for those who serve Him.

questions.question: How does Deuteronomy 18 instruct believers regarding the abominations practiced by other nations?
options: Do not learn to do after the abominations of those nations
Adopt some customs if they seem harmless
Ignore the customs but do not speak against them
questions.correctAnswer: Do not learn to do after the abominations of those nations
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 18:9 commands believers not to imitate the abominable practices of the nations they will possess, teaching obedience and holiness in conduct.

questions.question: What is forbidden among God's people according to Deuteronomy 18:10-11?
options: Divination, witchcraft, and consulting familiar spirits
questions.correctAnswer: Divination, witchcraft, and consulting familiar spirits
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 18:10-11 lists practices such as divination, witchcraft, and consulting with familiar spirits as abominations, teaching believers to avoid occult practices and trust in God alone.

questions.question: What attitude toward God does Deuteronomy 18:13 encourage believers to have?
options: Be perfect with the LORD thy God
Follow only what seems right to you
questions.correctAnswer: Be perfect with the LORD thy God
questions.explanation: Verse 13 calls believers to be perfect with God, reflecting wholehearted obedience and faithfulness as an expression of trust and reverence.

questions.question: How can believers discern a true prophet according to Deuteronomy 18?
options: If the prophet's words come to pass, he is from the LORD
If the prophet speaks eloquently, he is true
If he claims to be popular among the people
If he performs miracles by his own power
questions.correctAnswer: If the prophet's words come to pass, he is from the LORD
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 18:21-22 explains that a true prophet’s words will come to pass; if not, the prophet has spoken presumptuously and is not from God.

questions.question: What promise does God make about a Prophet in Deuteronomy 18:15-18?
options: God will raise up a Prophet like Moses from among the brethren
God will send many prophets to each tribe
God will only speak through angels
God will not send any more prophets
questions.correctAnswer: God will raise up a Prophet like Moses from among the brethren
questions.explanation: Verses 15-18 promise that God will raise up a Prophet like Moses from among the Israelites, teaching the importance of listening to God's chosen spokesman.

questions.question: How does Deuteronomy 18 teach about obedience to God's word through His prophets?
options: Whoever will not hearken to the prophet's words will be held accountable
Prophets' words are optional to obey
questions.correctAnswer: Whoever will not hearken to the prophet's words will be held accountable
questions.explanation: Verse 19 teaches that those who do not listen to the words spoken by the prophet in God's name will be held accountable, emphasizing obedience to God's revelation.

questions.question: What consequence is given for a prophet who presumptuously speaks in God's name what He has not commanded?
questions.correctAnswer: That prophet shall die
questions.explanation: Verse 20 clearly states that a prophet who speaks presumptuously in God's name or in the name of other gods shall die, underscoring the seriousness of speaking for God.

questions.question: How does Deuteronomy 18 guide us in parenting regarding evil practices?
options: Do not make your children pass through the fire or engage in occult practices
Allow children to explore all religious practices
questions.correctAnswer: Do not make your children pass through the fire or engage in occult practices
questions.explanation: Verse 10 forbids making children pass through fire or practicing divination, teaching parents to protect their children from occult and idolatrous practices.

questions.question: How does Deuteronomy 18 emphasize integrity in spiritual leadership?
options: Levites are chosen to minister forever in God's name
Levites are to seek personal gain over service
Any person can become a priest without God’s choice
Levites must rely on their own strength
questions.correctAnswer: Levites are chosen to minister forever in God's name
questions.explanation: Verse 5 states that God chose the Levites to minister in His name forever, highlighting the divine calling and integrity required in spiritual service.

questions.question: True or False: Deuteronomy 18 allows believers to consult with familiar spirits and witches as long as it is done secretly.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Verses 10-12 clearly forbid consulting with familiar spirits, witches, and related practices as abominations to the LORD, regardless of secrecy.

questions.question: True or False: According to Deuteronomy 18, the LORD is the inheritance of the Levites instead of land possessions.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verses 1-2 explain that the Levites have no land inheritance because the LORD Himself is their inheritance, teaching trust in God's provision.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The LORD will raise up a Prophet from among your brethren, like unto ___; unto him ye shall hearken.
questions.correctAnswer: Moses
questions.explanation: Verse 15 states that the LORD will raise up a Prophet like unto Moses, emphasizing the importance of listening to this Prophet’s words.

hard.title: Deuteronomy Chapter 18 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Deuteronomy Chapter 18.

questions.question: According to Deuteronomy 18, what is the inheritance of the Levites within Israel?
options: They have no inheritance among their brethren; the LORD is their inheritance
They receive land equal to other tribes
They inherit the cities of refuge exclusively
questions.correctAnswer: They have no inheritance among their brethren; the LORD is their inheritance
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 18:1-2 states that the Levites shall have no part or inheritance among Israel; instead, the LORD Himself is their inheritance.

questions.question: What portions of a sacrifice are given to the priests as their due from the people?
options: The shoulder, the two cheeks, and the maw
The head, the feet, and the tail
The fat tail and the firstborn lamb
questions.correctAnswer: The shoulder, the two cheeks, and the maw
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 18:3 specifies that priests receive the shoulder, two cheeks, and maw from the animals offered as sacrifices.

questions.question: What types of offerings besides animals does Deuteronomy 18 instruct the people to give to the Levites?
options: Firstfruits of corn, wine, oil, and fleece of sheep
Portions of the harvest and fruit trees
questions.correctAnswer: Firstfruits of corn, wine, oil, and fleece of sheep
questions.explanation: According to Deuteronomy 18:4, the firstfruits of corn, wine, oil, and the first of the fleece of sheep are to be given to the Levites.

questions.question: What is the reason God chose the Levites out of all the tribes?
options: To stand and minister in the name of the LORD forever
To receive the land of Canaan
To lead the tribes into battle
questions.correctAnswer: To stand and minister in the name of the LORD forever
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 18:5 explains that God chose the Levites to minister in His name, both them and their descendants forever.

questions.question: What does Deuteronomy 18:9-12 forbid the Israelites from practicing?
options: Divination, witchcraft, necromancy, and passing children through fire
questions.correctAnswer: Divination, witchcraft, necromancy, and passing children through fire
questions.explanation: Verses 10-12 prohibit practices like divination, witchcraft, necromancy, and making children pass through fire as abominations to the LORD.

questions.question: Deuteronomy 18:13 commands the Israelites to be "perfect" with the LORD. What Hebrew concept does this term most closely relate to?
options: To be complete or blameless in covenant faithfulness
To be physically flawless in sacrifices
To be circumcised in heart and flesh
questions.correctAnswer: To be complete or blameless in covenant faithfulness
questions.explanation: The Hebrew word for perfect here (תמים, tamim) implies being complete or blameless in obedience and faithfulness to God’s covenant.

questions.question: What future figure is prophesied in Deuteronomy 18:15 who will be like Moses?
options: A Prophet raised up from among the brethren
A new king who will conquer nations
A priest anointed with the Holy Spirit
A judge to deliver Israel from oppression
questions.correctAnswer: A Prophet raised up from among the brethren
questions.explanation: Verse 15 foretells a Prophet like Moses whom God will raise up from Israel’s brethren, to whom the people must listen.

questions.question: What was the Israelite assembly's request at Horeb that relates to the prophecy of the future prophet?
options: That they not hear God's voice directly again or see the great fire
That they have a permanent priesthood established
That they be led into the promised land immediately
questions.correctAnswer: That they not hear God's voice directly again or see the great fire
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 18:16 recounts that the people requested not to hear God's voice or see the fire again to avoid death, prompting God to promise a prophet to speak for Him.

questions.question: What does God promise to do for the prophet He will raise up according to Deuteronomy 18:18?
options: Put His words in the prophet's mouth
Give him power to perform miracles
Grant him the throne of David
Anoint him with oil from the tabernacle
questions.correctAnswer: Put His words in the prophet's mouth
questions.explanation: Verse 18 states God will put His words in the mouth of the prophet, who will speak all that God commands.

questions.question: What consequence does Deuteronomy 18:19 describe for those who refuse to listen to the prophet speaking in God's name?
options: God will require it of them
They will be excommunicated from Israel
They will be struck with plagues
They will lose their land inheritance
questions.correctAnswer: God will require it of them
questions.explanation: Verse 19 declares that whoever will not listen to the prophet’s words spoken in God's name will be held accountable by God Himself.

questions.question: What punishment is prescribed for a prophet who presumptuously speaks a word in God's name that He has not commanded?
options: That prophet shall be publicly rebuked
That prophet shall be forgiven if repents
questions.correctAnswer: That prophet shall die
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 18:20 clearly states such a prophet must die for speaking presumptuously or in the name of other gods.

questions.question: How can one discern if a prophet's word is truly from the LORD according to Deuteronomy 18:21-22?
options: If the prediction does not come to pass, the LORD did not speak it
If the prophet performs miracles, he is true
If the prophet is from a priestly family, he is authentic
If the prophet speaks in parables, he is from God
questions.correctAnswer: If the prediction does not come to pass, the LORD did not speak it
questions.explanation: Verses 21-22 instruct that if a prophet's words do not come to pass, the message is not from God and was spoken presumptuously.

questions.question: True or False: Deuteronomy 18 allows the Israelites to learn and practice the divination customs of the nations they will dispossess.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 18:9 forbids the Israelites from learning to do the abominations of the nations they will dispossess, including divination and witchcraft.

questions.question: Which theme from Deuteronomy 18 is echoed in the New Testament concerning Jesus Christ?
options: Jesus as the Prophet like Moses raised from among the brethren
Jesus as a Levite ministering in the temple
Jesus as a king appointed by Saul
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus as the Prophet like Moses raised from among the brethren
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 18:15-18 foreshadows the coming of a prophet like Moses, a theme referenced in Acts 3:22-23 as fulfilled in Jesus.

questions.question: What is the significance of the Levites having 'like portions to eat' beside the sale of their patrimony as stated in Deuteronomy 18:8?
options: It ensured their sustenance since they had no land inheritance
It was a tax to support the king
It was a payment for military service
It was a symbolic gesture without material benefit
questions.correctAnswer: It ensured their sustenance since they had no land inheritance
questions.explanation: Verse 8 explains that Levites receive portions to eat in addition to income from their property sales, reflecting their unique role without land inheritance.

theological.title: Deuteronomy Chapter 18 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Deuteronomy Chapter 18 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Deuteronomy 18, what is the inheritance of the Levites among the Israelites?
options: They have no inheritance; the LORD is their inheritance
They receive land in every tribe
They share equally with all tribes
questions.correctAnswer: They have no inheritance; the LORD is their inheritance
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 18:1-2 states that the Levites shall have no part nor inheritance with Israel; the LORD Himself is their inheritance. This is consistent with Numbers 18:20 and 1 Chronicles 6:33, where God appoints the Levites to serve Him directly. Hebrews 7:5 also notes the priestly role without an earthly inheritance.

questions.question: What portions of the sacrifice are the priests entitled to according to Deuteronomy 18?
options: The shoulder, two cheeks, and maw
questions.correctAnswer: The shoulder, two cheeks, and maw
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 18:3 specifies that the priests shall receive the shoulder, the two cheeks, and the maw from sacrifices. This reflects the priestly portion prescribed for their sustenance, also seen in Leviticus 7:32-34 and Numbers 18:8-9.

questions.question: What is forbidden for the Israelites to learn or practice in the land given by God, as stated in Deuteronomy 18?
questions.correctAnswer: Divination, witchcraft, and necromancy
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 18:9-12 explicitly forbids Israelites from practicing divination, witchcraft, necromancy, and related occult practices. This prohibition aligns with Leviticus 19:26, 20:6, and Isaiah 8:19, emphasizing God's holiness and rejection of occultism.

questions.question: Who does Deuteronomy 18 say God will raise up among the Israelites, like Moses?
options: A prophet from among their brethren
A king from the tribe of Judah
A priest from the tribe of Levi
A judge from the tribe of Benjamin
questions.correctAnswer: A prophet from among their brethren
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 18:15,18 promises God will raise up a prophet like Moses from among the Israelites to whom the people must listen. This prophetic promise is fulfilled in Jesus Christ (Acts 3:22-23, John 6:14, Hebrews 3:1) who speaks God's words perfectly.

questions.question: What will happen to a prophet who presumptuously speaks in God's name a word He has not commanded, according to Deuteronomy 18?
options: That prophet will be sent to exile
questions.correctAnswer: That prophet shall die
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 18:20 declares that a prophet who speaks presumptuously a word in God's name that He has not commanded must die. This underlines the seriousness of true prophecy, echoed in Jeremiah 23:30-32 and Ezekiel 13:9, emphasizing faithfulness to God’s word.

questions.question: According to Deuteronomy 18, how can one discern if a prophet truly speaks the word of the LORD?
options: If the prophecy comes to pass
questions.correctAnswer: If the prophecy comes to pass
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 18:21-22 teaches that a prophet’s word is from the LORD if the predicted events actually occur. This criterion is supported in Jeremiah 28:9 and 1 Kings 22:28, safeguarding against false prophecy.

questions.question: What is the role of the Levites who come from other cities to the place the LORD chooses, as described in Deuteronomy 18?
options: To minister before the LORD like their brethren
To serve as judges in the tribes
questions.correctAnswer: To minister before the LORD like their brethren
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 18:6-7 explains that Levites who come from any gates of Israel to the LORD’s chosen place shall minister before the LORD as their brethren do. This is consistent with Numbers 18:23-24 and 1 Chronicles 23:3-4.

questions.question: What does Deuteronomy 18 command the Israelites to be in their relationship with the LORD God?
questions.correctAnswer: Perfect
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 18:13 exhorts the Israelites to be perfect with the LORD their God, meaning to be wholehearted and blameless in obedience. This aligns with Matthew 5:48 and 1 Peter 1:16, calling God’s people to holiness.

questions.question: What offerings are the Israelites commanded to give to the Levites besides parts of the sacrifices, according to Deuteronomy 18?
options: Firstfruits of corn, wine, oil, and the first of the fleece of sheep
questions.correctAnswer: Firstfruits of corn, wine, oil, and the first of the fleece of sheep
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 18:4 directs that the firstfruits of grain, wine, oil, and the first fleece of sheep be given to the priests. This offering sustains the priests and is echoed in Proverbs 3:9 and Exodus 23:19.

questions.question: According to Deuteronomy 18, why does the LORD drive out nations that practice abominations like divination and witchcraft?
options: Because these abominations grieve the LORD
Because they do not worship idols
questions.correctAnswer: Because these abominations grieve the LORD
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 18:12 explains that the LORD drives out nations because their abominations, such as divination and witchcraft, are detestable to Him. This teaching corresponds with Leviticus 18:24-30 and Isaiah 59:4.

questions.question: What did the Israelites request at Horeb, as referenced in Deuteronomy 18, regarding God's voice and fire?
options: To not hear God's voice or see the great fire again
To have more manifestations of God's fire
To build a temple for God
To have a king to lead them
questions.correctAnswer: To not hear God's voice or see the great fire again
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 18:16 recounts the Israelites’ desire at Horeb to not hear God's voice or see the fire again, fearing death. This event is also recorded in Exodus 20:18-19 and Hebrews 12:18-21, illustrating God's holiness and the people's fear.

questions.question: How does Deuteronomy 18 describe the communication between God and the prophet He raises up?
options: God will put His words in the prophet's mouth
The prophet will write new scriptures
questions.correctAnswer: God will put His words in the prophet's mouth
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 18:18 states that God will put His words into the mouth of the prophet He raises up, who will speak all He commands. This divine inspiration is affirmed in Jeremiah 1:9 and 2 Peter 1:21.

questions.question: What does Deuteronomy 18 say will happen to whoever does not listen to the words spoken by the prophet raised by the LORD?
options: God will require it of him
questions.correctAnswer: God will require it of him
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 18:19 warns that whoever refuses to listen to the prophet’s words spoken in God's name will be held accountable by God. This principle is echoed in Ezekiel 3:18-19 and John 12:48.

questions.question: In Deuteronomy 18, what is the significance of the LORD choosing the tribe of Levi to minister forever?
options: They are chosen to stand and minister in God's name forever
They are given land and kingship
They will lead Israel into battle
questions.correctAnswer: They are chosen to stand and minister in God's name forever
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 18:5 teaches that God chose the Levites to minister in His name perpetually, establishing their unique priestly role. This is consistent with Numbers 3:12 and Hebrews 7:23-24 regarding the eternal priesthood.

questions.question: How does Deuteronomy 18 describe the portions given to Levites who minister at the LORD’s chosen place compared to others?
options: They shall have like portions to eat besides income from sale of patrimony
They shall have no portions at all
questions.correctAnswer: They shall have like portions to eat besides income from sale of patrimony
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 18:8 explains Levites ministering at the LORD’s place receive portions to eat like their brethren, plus any income from selling their ancestral property. This is consistent with Numbers 18:20-24 and Nehemiah 13:29.

questions.question: What is the relationship between the prohibition of occult practices and the nations the Israelites will dispossess, according to Deuteronomy 18?
options: Those nations practiced occult abominations, which God forbids Israel to follow
Those nations worshiped the true God
Those nations were peaceful and just
questions.correctAnswer: Those nations practiced occult abominations, which God forbids Israel to follow
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 18:9-14 contrasts Israel with the nations they will dispossess, who engaged in forbidden occult practices. God forbids Israel from imitating these abominations, consistent with Leviticus 20:23 and Ezekiel 22:26.
